description: The Pharmacy Guild criticised the merger, warning it could limit wholesaling options and potentially raise costs for patients.
title: Chemist Warehouse and Sigma $8.8 Billion Merger Approved

description: Remembrance Day ceremonies are planned throughout Canada from Halifax to Ottawa to Vancouver on Nov. 11 to pay tribute to those who have made the ultimate sacrifice for the country. The country’s biggest ceremony, hosted by the Royal Canadian Legion, will be in Ottawa at the National War Memorial. It will begin around 10:45 a.m. […]
title: Remembrance Day Ceremonies From Coast to Coast

description: Commentary Suppose you’re scheduled for major heart surgery. Shortly before your surgery begins, you check into your surgeon’s background and are pleased to discover your surgeon had a 100 percent average throughout medical school. But then you learn that every student at the same medical school received 100 percent in their courses, too. Now you […]
title: Michael Zwaagstra: ‘Grade Inflation’ Gives Students False Sense of Their Academic Abilities

description: A former Ontario teacher has been given the go-ahead by the Ontario Court of Appeal to bring a defamation lawsuit against the Waterloo Regional District School Board (WRDSB). Justices Benjamin Zarnett, Patrick J. Monahan, and Renee M. Pomerance on Nov. 5 dismissed an appeal filed by the school board of an earlier court decision in […]
title: Ontario Appeals Court Allows Defamation Case of Former Teacher Concerned About Age-Appropriateness of Books to Proceed

description: Commentary It is now five years since Don Cherry was fired by Rogers Sportsnet for comments he made regarding the need for Remembrance Day to be more fully embraced by newcomers to Canada. This is what he said: “You people … you love our way of life, you love our milk and honey, at least […]
title: Peter Menzies: Remembrance Day Is About the Sacrifices of Our Soldiers, Not Modern Sensibilities

description: Israeli Jewish football fans were targeted by attackers shouting ‘Free Palestine’ slogans.
title: Bill Ackman Seeks to Delist Companies From Amsterdam After Attack on Israelis

description: Gangs in France are forming semi-autonomous 'narco-enclaves' in quiet towns, emboldened by a reduced police presence, warns a veteran French police commander.
title: France Grapples With ‘Mexicanized’ Narco-Enclaves

description: Those in Netanyahu's sphere see the returning U.S. president much more in line with Israel's needs. Some on the left warn Trump may pursue his own course.
title: Some Israelis Hail Trump’s Win, Others Express Fears

description: More than one hundred died in 2024 because of torture and abuse.
title: Persecution of Falun Gong Adherents Continues as Thousands Reported Imprisoned, Tortured This Year

description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates—Yemen’s Houthi terrorists shot down what bystanders described as an American drone early Friday, potentially the latest downing of a U.S. spy drone as the terrorists continue their attacks on the Red Sea corridor. The U.S. military acknowledged the videos circulating online showing what appeared to be a flaming aircraft dropping out […]
title: Houthis Claim to Have Shot Down US Drone in Yemen

description: MADRID—The catastrophic torrential rains that overflowed rivers and normally dry canals in eastern Spain last week triggered flash floods that submerged entire communities and killed scores of people. The deluge left behind a landscape of devastation, especially in Valencia, the hardest-hit region. The search for the dead and missing continues, more than a week since […]
title: Spain’s Catastrophic Floods by the Numbers: At Least 219 Dead, 93 Missing, and Billions in Damage

description: The Airborne Corps’ core mission is to ‘liberate Taiwan’ as a rapid reaction unit.
title: Xi Visits PLA Airborne Force Amid Speculation of Weakened Grip on Power

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Nov. 8 signed two new laws to strengthen Manila’s maritime sovereignty and establish sea lanes for passing foreign vessels—a move that drew ire from Beijing. During a signing ceremony attended by Philippine lawmakers and senior officials, Marcos said the new laws would strengthen the country’s economic development and national […]
title: Philippine President Signs New Laws to Secure Sea Rights Amid China Tensions

description: Experts and children are sharing feasibility, privacy, and scope fears about Australia’s incoming social media ban for children younger than 16. The social media age restriction was signed off on by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and state and territory leaders on Nov. 8 but questions remain over its implementation. Justine Humphry, one of three authors […]
title: Social Media Ban ‘Unenforceable’, Experts Say

description: Australian electric car owners could use their vehicle batteries to keep the lights on this Christmas after the arrival of a long-awaited policy change.  Federal Energy Minister Chris Bowen is expected to announce a standard for vehicle-to-grid technology at the Sydney International EV Show on Nov. 9, allowing electric cars to work as household batteries […]
title: Electric Cars Could Keep Lights on in Australian Homes

description: After reaching an all-time high in May, the average rent in Canada fell in October to its lowest level in 12 months, marking the first year-on-year decline since the pandemic, according to a new report. Average prices, however, remain at their highest levels since they began rising three years ago. The average asking rent for […]
title: Average Rent Drops for First Time in Years but Remains Above Pre-Pandemic Levels

description: Chris Minns is “deeply sorry” to anyone affected by escalating industrial action in New South Wales (NSW), as frontline workers continue their push for major pay increases. The NSW premier has not yet reached an agreement with nurses and midwives, who plan to stop work for 24 hours on Nov. 13 after four weeks of […]
title: ‘Deeply Sorry’: NSW Braces for Big Train, Nurse Strikes

description: Federal Employment Minister Randy Boissonnault says a company he once co-owned did not have his consent when it claimed to be indigenous-owned while bidding on federal contracts. His comments came after the National Post reported on Nov. 7 it has obtained documents showing that Boissonnaut’s former business partner, Stephen Anderson, described Global Health Imports Corporation […]
title: Employment Minister Says His Former Company Claimed to be Indigenous-Owned Without His Consent

description: One in four parents report eating less so their children can have food, according to a report from The Salvation Army. The report, 2024 Canadian Poverty and Socioeconomic Analysis, looks at Canadian’s behaviours and attitudes on issues such as housing, food, health care, and affordability from year to year. In 2024, it found that Canadian […]
title: Nearly a Quarter of Canadian Parents Cut Back on Meals so Kids Can Eat: Report

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Swift Wildfire, Legislators’ Attack, and a Respectful 2-Minute Silence

description: Fruit and vegetable providers depend on supermarkets but lack negotiating power and face significant costs to supply the industry giants, an inquiry has heard. Producers are highly reliant on Coles, Woolworths, and Aldi for vegetable sales, the industry’s peak body told the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission probe on Nov. 8. About 98 percent of […]
title: Farmers Fear Being Frozen out by Supermarket Giants

description: The four defendants were arrested in China and face similar charges there, but they won't be extradited.
title: Wuhan Chemical Company Officials Face Charges Over Fentanyl Production and Sales in US

description: The Australian share market has climbed for its third day in a row on hopes of stimulus from Beijing and a U.S. central bank cautious when queried on the inflationary outlook under a second Trump presidency. At close on Nov. 8, the S&P/ASX 200 index finished 68.8 points, or 0.8 percent, higher at 8295.1. The […]
title: Australian Bourse Gets a Boost After Offshore Rate Cuts
